US attacks Iran, thrusting Middle East war into total uncertainty
description: After pretending to hesitate, Donald Trump took a historic risk by deciding to bomb three Iranian nuclear sites, without congressional authorization. While all eyes are turning to Iran, Israel finds itself with a rare opportunity to bring down the regime in Tehran.

description: Francis's successor at the Vatican lived for many years in the South American country. Le Monde traveled to the city of Chiclayo to meet with several people who remember the days when he was still known as Robert Prevost.

headline: 'A furnace': Life under Paris's zinc roofs during a heatwave
description: On Saturday, the French capital faced a heatwave, with temperatures reaching up to 36°C. The residents of the city's 'chambres de bonne,' small top-floor flats, struggled to cope.

headline: 'Jaws' turns 50: A foundational film that changed cinema
description: The incredible success of Steven Spielberg's film, released simultaneously across the US at the very start of summer 1975, was the result of a wild gamble by Universal that revolutionized Hollywood, writes Le Monde's Michel Guerrin in his column.

headline: Once, Israel and Iran were allies – even under the ayatollahs
description: Israel not only maintained a strategic partnership with the shah's regime for three decades, but also gave decisive support to the Islamic Republic of Iran in its war against Iraq, writes Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

description: Silicon Valley's top executives are almost all captivated by the Roman Empire and its decline. Their obsession shapes how they see the world.

headline: Beyoncé brings Texas flair to Paris
description: The American superstar performed the first of three concerts at the arena in Saint-Denis on Thursday. The show centered on tracks from her latest album, Cowboy Carter.

headline: How Trump broke with his strategic allies to side with Russia over Ukraine
description: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (5/5). After Barack Obama stepped back during the 2014 annexation of Crimea and Joe Biden hesitated, Donald Trump, now back in the White House, aligned himself with Russia at the UN and left his strategic allies alone to face Vladimir Putin.
